summary: The 'Securing Enhanced Programs, Systems, and Initiatives for Sepsis Act' aims to reduce sepsis rates in the United States. It mandates the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to maintain a sepsis team, improve data collection (especially for pediatric cases), and share information to improve patient outcomes. The bill directs the Secretary to establish a voluntary hospital honor roll program. Furthermore, it requires reports to Congress on outcome measures, sepsis activities, and the impact of best practices, with appropriations authorized for fiscal years 2026-2030.
